Text:
This is a tale of Zeta, one of the Seven Shadows,
who wanders the land gathering intel.

It's getting awfully late. It'll probably be any
minute now...
Welcome...
Hmm... My, your place is bustlingâ€”even late at night.
Your order, Miss?
Your best wine, please. And keep it coming.

Wooo, hey, babe. You can really knock 'em back,
can't ya?
I dunno, can I?

No way anyone who drinks like you can be sober. Guess
I can't get you in bed by getting you drunk, eh?

Wow, bold of you to outright say you want to get me
in bed. But I think you should give it up.
C'mon, you're in a bar alone, late at night...

That means you're probably a hustler, working for
some gang... But I still can't let a doll face like you
get away from me.

What are you driveling about? I'm just a solo traveler,
going where my mood takes me. I just got hereâ€”
I was looking for a place to stay the night.

(The trick is to sprinkle your lies into something
that's mostly true.)

(It's true that I'm traveling solo. It's true that I'm looking
for a place to stay. The part about going where my
mood takes me was the lie.)

Hey, Bartender, is there a room available on the
second floor?
Yeah, we've got a single. Is that okay?

Not a problem. Just charge me when I close out my
bar tab.
Could you put a double bed in that room?
Give up, honey. I'm not looking for that.

Argh...a dead end, eh? Well, I guess tonight's
a lost cause. Everyone has started leaving.

(That's right. I'd actually arrived at this bar and
inn a while earlier...around dinnertime.)

(I waited deep into the night for the customers
to leave...because it's easier to snoop in on
conversations that way.)

(Also, the drunker the customers become, the looser
their tongues get... It's like an all-you-can-eat buffet
of intel.)

(I've set up operations at the center of the bar.
This way, I can hear all the conversations.)
Ooh, are you suuure you're okay with paying for meee?

Yes, yes, I insist. We must treat our travelers with
kindness. Drink up! You've had a hard journey.

(There's a middle-aged manâ€”a localâ€”sitting at a table
towards the back... He didn't even give me a glance
when I walked in after himâ€”he's too absorbed in the
traveler who was here first. Hmmm?)

Oop-oop-oop! *gulp, gulp* P'ahhh! Than' you ver'
much. This booze's real' good.

Yes, the water around here is very pure, so the
produce and liquor are really tasty. We've even
got golden fruit here.

(Golden fruit? Never heard of it... The traveler will
probably take the bait.)
Golden fruit? What's that?

It's a specialty of a golden village not too far from
here. If you eat the fruit, you become rich.
(You become rich? Okay, it's definitely fake. But...)

Actually, I ate a little of the golden fruit myself.
And now I'm rich enough to treat fine travelers
such as yourself to drinks.

Oooh, so the fruit makes your money-luck go up-up-up,
huh? Maybe I should go check it out tomorrowâ€”it'll
make a good story for my friends.

Yes, I highly recommend that. Here's a map to the
golden village.

Oooh, wow, thanks for everything. I'd better go
tomorrow...

Yes, you really should go. But you'd better get
a good night's sleep tonight.

Yeahhh, true. Well, excuse me... Thanks forrr...
ev'r'thing...t'day...

(Okay. The traveler is walking towards me on his way
up to the second floor...)

Thanks for the drink, bartender. Where might my
room be?
The corner room on the second floor.
Got it. Thanks. Well, goodnight...
Woop-oop-oop...earthquake?

Are you okay, sir? You're the one who's shaking. Let
me help you up the stairs.
Thanks, Miss. Gee, all the locals here are so nice.

I'm a traveler, though... Come on, watch your feet on
the first step.
Have a good night, sir. Take care of yourself.
Phew... Okay, let's have a look at that map you got.

Aha...that's a well-made map. Though I doubt the
"golden village" actually exists...

Personal biases aside, if this golden fruit really did exist,
the Shadow Garden could make good use of it.

And if it doesn't exist...things're gonna get
interesting. Heehee...
